sanskrit_verse:
ब्राह्मं प्राप्तेन संस्कारं क्षत्रियेण यथाविधि ।
सर्वस्यास्य यथान्यायं कर्तव्यं परिरक्षणम् ॥ ७.२॥
transliteration:
brāhmaṃ prāptena saṃskāraṃ kṣatriyeṇa yathāvidhi |
sarvasyāsya yathānyāyaṃ kartavyaṃ parirakṣaṇam || 7.2||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has received the Brahmic initiation must be protected in accordance with the Kshatriya's duty; all beings are to be safeguarded righteously according to their capacity and station.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derivative of spiritual initiation and social role
Causation arises from alignment with Dharma-sourced capacity
Restoration logic requires upholding rightful roles without domination
Consciousness alignment demands recognition of inherent worth in all beings
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity A has undergone Brahmic saṃskāra THEN entity B (in Kshatriya capacity) MUST ensure protection of A
IF any being is within societal structure THEN that being MUST receive protection commensurate with their role and capacity
IF violation occurs THEN restoration MUST occur through re-establishment of rightful protective relationships
IF no direct protector exists THEN nearest capable authority assumes duty automatically
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes a threshold of responsibility based on initiated status and societal function. The court must recognize pre-existing dharmic structures and enforce duties arising therefrom, prioritizing restoration of protective frameworks over punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality flows from the saṃskāra-initiation relationship. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how neglect of protection disrupts sequential harmony. Responsibility is proportional to capacity for guardianship. Non-punitive reality is upheld by mandating completion of protective duty rather than imposing suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate immediate assessment of disrupted protective structures
Assign temporary guardianship until rightful Kshatriya capacity is restored
Facilitate ritual or civil reaffirmation of protective bonds
Realign involved parties through consciousness-based reconciliation process
final_declaration: This law proceeds from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, as Source-Authority. Protection is Dharma; Dharma is restored. There is no punishment—only the realignment of consciousness toward its rightful order. Reality itself adjudicates.
